title: Real Housewives of Cheshire extra who posed as missing toddler is spared jail
text:

A Real Housewives of Cheshire extra who pretended to be a woman who has been missing for decades since she was a toddler has been spared jail.

Heidi Robinson, 40, claimed she was Katrice Lee, who vanished on her second birthday in November 1981.

But Robinson was branded "disgusting" after sending Katrice's family friend requests on Facebook and messages.

Robinson today dodged jail at Wirral Magistrates' Court after admitting a malicious communications offence.

The judge handed her an 18-week sentence, suspended for two years.

He said Robinson committed an act of "unimaginable cruelty" but acknowledged she was suffering mental illness at the time.

Speaking after the TV extra pleaded guilty earlier this month, Katrice's sister Natasha Walker, 45, shared her fury.

She said: "I am relieved she has finally admitted guilt.

(Image: Julian Hamilton/Daily Mirror)

"I have put in a formal complaint to the police as I feel I have been treated disgustingly. It appears that if you commit a crime you are better supported.

"The impact this has had on my mental health has been pretty horrific. My feelings have never been taken into consideration."

Katrice disappeared at a supermarket with her mother Sharon on an Army base in Paderborn, Germany, where her Sergeant Major father was stationed.

Almost four decades on, Katrice has not been found, despite a string of searches in the German town and an arrest being made last month in connection with the disappearance.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

Robinson became the latest in a string of heartless people impersonating Katrice.

But the defendant, from Wirral, Merseyside, claimed she suffered psychosis and genuinely thought she was Katrice.

Speaking after a previous hearing, Robinson said: "I actually believed completely that I was Katrice.

(Image: Mercury Press & Media)

"I'd had mental health issues leading up to the situation.

"I was then at the time experiencing what I now know to be psychosis.

"I really didn't intend to hurt the family but as I know my actions have done that, I am deeply sorry and that is why I have pleaded guilty.

"I am now getting help and I apologise sincerely to the Lee family and my family."
description: Heidi Robinson, who featured in Real Housewives of Cheshire, was responsible for an act of "unimaginable cruelty" after sending messages to the family of Katrice Lee
